page.title: 12RAILWAY - ASHPERTON
page.content: The main line from Hereford to Worcester crosses the A417 south of the village. When the railway was first built in 1861 there was a station at Ashperton which was of great importance to the area. It had up and down line platforms with a footbridge across; and was used for the movement of livestock, timber, fertilizers and coal. Special trains were laid on to bring hop-pickers from the Midlands, South Wales and Bristol for the hop-picking season every September. Ashperton Station and its buildings was demolished in 1966 when the railway system was reduced but working continued on the two lines until 1984 when one line was closed. The unused track is being removed from the Ashperton section of the line at this moment. Maintenance work is carried out at night or on Sundays.
